original: 1.8 “Insolvency Event ” means (a) without a successor, the specified party fails to function as a going concern or to operate in the ordinary course, or (b) other than in the case when the specified party is a debtor-in-possession and continuing to fulfill all its obligations under this Agreement, a receiver or trustee in bankruptcy is appointed for such party or its property, or such party makes a general assignment for the benefit of its creditors, or such party commences, or has commenced against it, proceedings under any bankruptcy, insolvency or debtor’s relief law, in each case which proceedings are not dismissed within ninety (90) days.

original: 1.16 “Net Sales ” means the invoiced amounts for the Sale of Products less: (a) amounts credited for return of any such Products; (b) amounts separately stated with respect to shipment of such Products for insurance, handling, duty, freight, and taxes; and (c) any discounts, credits or rebates in the relevant royalty or service fee period.
ollama_generated: 1.16 "Gross Sales" refers to the total amounts billed for the purchase of Products, inclusive of: (a) any credits granted for returned Products; (b) costs specifically itemized concerning shipping, insurance, handling, customs duty, transport, and taxes associated with such Products; and (c) any discounts, price reductions, or refunds that have been applied in the relevant royalty or service fee duration, but excluding the initial sale value. The Buyer shall be responsible for deducting these amounts from the Gross Sales to calculate Net Sales for purposes of this Agreement.

   (e) Any modifications, amendments, or additions to this Agreement must be in writing and signed by both Parties.
   (f) This Agreement constitutes the entire understanding between the Parties regarding the subject matter hereof. Any prior understandings, agreements, or representations are superseded by this Agreement.
   (g) If any provision of this Agreement is determined to be invalid or unenforceable, all other provisions shall remain in full force and effect.
   (h) The Parties acknowledge that they have had the opportunity to seek independent legal advice prior to executing this Agreement.
   (i) Any notices, demands, or communications required or permitted under this Agreement shall be in writing and delivered personally, by courier service, by facsimile, or email.
   (j) This Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument. No Party may waive any rights under this Agreement without the written consent of the other Party.

original: 4.2 Commercialization Meetings . The parties will meet regularly, but at least once each month during the Term, either in person or by telephone, video or internet conference call, to share technical and commercial information as reasonably required to facilitate the parties’ exercise of their respective rights and performance of their respective obligations under this Agreement. The information shared by the parties will include, but is not limited to (a) market and competitive dynamic updates, (b) activities and progress updates at DIALOG’s customers, (c) technical review and feedback from customers, (d) non-binding 12 month rolling Sales and Royalty and Service Fee forecasts for the Licensed Products, (e) initiatives to boost sales potential for the Licensed Products. Customer information shared will be within the limits allowed by any non-disclosure agreements DIALOG may have entered into with such customers.
ollama_generated: 4.2 Commercialization Meetings . While it is anticipated that the parties will meet regularly, the frequency and mode of these meetings (in person or via telephone, video or internet conference calls) shall be determined by mutual agreement between the parties. These meetings are intended to support the exercise of the parties' rights and fulfillment of their obligations under this Agreement, but are not mandatory unless expressly agreed upon by both parties. The information shared during these meetings will include, but is not limited to (a) market and competitive dynamic updates, (b) activities and progress updates at DIALOG’s customers, (c) technical review and feedback from customers, (d) non-binding 12 month rolling Sales and Royalty and Service Fee forecasts for the Licensed Products, (e) initiatives to boost sales potential for the Licensed Products. It is understood that any customer information shared will be subject to the limitations imposed by any non-disclosure agreements DIALOG may have with such customers. The obligation to hold these meetings lies primarily with DIALOG, but both parties are expected to actively participate and contribute.

original: (d) In the event any warranty claim is due to or arises from an Epidemic Defect, ENERGOUS will be responsible for all costs and expenses directly incurred by DIALOG or its Affiliates or their respective customers as a result of reasonable inspection, servicing, repairs, replacements, recall notices, recalls and responses with respect thereto, provided that ENERGOUS’ aggregate liability to DIALOG and its Affiliates and their respective customers under this paragraph (d) will not exceed [***] per occurrence of an Epidemic Defect. Each party will immediately notify the other upon becoming aware of the circumstance that could reasonably be construed to be an indication of an Epidemic Defect, and, in any event, will notify the other party immediately upon becoming aware of the existence of an Epidemic Defect. ENERGOUS and DIALOG will expeditiously work together in good faith to determine a technical resolution of the Epidemic Failure. ENERGOUS agrees to make all commercially reasonable efforts to promptly diagnose the Epidemic Failure’s root cause, provide DIALOG a report detailing the results of ENERGOUS’ investigation and plan an effective workaround and a permanent solution. ENERGOUS will consult with DIALOG on any proposed workarounds and other solutions.
ollama_generated: (d) In the event that an Epidemic Defect is responsible for triggering any warranty claim, it shall be ENERGOUS' obligation to cover all costs and expenses incurred by DIALOG, its Affiliates, or their respective customers as a result of reasonable inspection, servicing, repairs, replacements, recall notices, recalls, and responses related thereto. However, ENERGOUS' total liability towards DIALOG, its Affiliates, and their respective customers under this section (d) shall be limited to [***] per occurrence of an Epidemic Defect. Each party will promptly notify the other upon discovering any circumstances that could potentially suggest an Epidemic Defect, and in all cases, will inform the other party immediately upon confirming the presence of an Epidemic Defect. ENERGOUS and DIALOG are expected to collaborate diligently in good faith to find a technical solution for the Epidemic Failure. ENERGOUS is committed to making every reasonable effort to swiftly identify the root cause of the Epidemic Failure, deliver a report detailing the findings of its investigation, and propose an effective workaround and permanent solution. ENERGOUS will consult DIALOG on all proposed workarounds and solutions.

employees, contractors, agents, distributors and customers (collectively, “ DIALOG Indemnitees ”) from and against and in respect of any and all alleged or actual demands, claims, actions, causes of action, suits or proceedings, assessments, awarded damages (including punitive damages), liabilities, interest and penalties, costs and expenses (including, without limitation, court costs and ollama_generated:
12.1 Indemnification Obligation of DIALOG. Subject to Section 12.2, DIALOG shall indemnify, hold harmless and, in the case of any third-party claims, defend ENERGOUS and its Affiliates and each of their respective directors, officers, employees, contractors, agents, distributors, and customers (collectively, "ENERGOUS Indemnitees") from and against any and all alleged or actual demands, claims, actions, causes of action, suits or proceedings, assessments, awarded damages (including punitive damages), liabilities, interest, penalties, costs, and expenses (each, a "Claim") to the extent resulting from, arising out of, relating to, or imposed upon or incurred by any ENERGOUS Indemnitees by reason of (a) death or bodily injury caused by or resulting from use of the Products by end users, (b) any breach of any representation or warranty made by DIALOG hereunder or to any third party in relation to the Products or Product Die, (c) the infringement or misappropriation of any third-party Intellectual Property Rights in relation to the Products or Product Die, (d) the infringement or misappropriation of any third-party Intellectual Property Rights as a result of ENERGOUS' exercise of rights in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, including, but not limited to, the Manufacturing Subcontractors' manufacture of the Products on their behalf, provided that the Products are manufactured in strict compliance with the Product Specifications and Approved Production Specifications and only to the extent such Claims arise due to non-compliance with the Product Specifications and/or the Approved Production Specifications or use of the Tooling provided by DIALOG hereunder, (e) the infringement by ENERGOUS of any third-party Marks rights as a result of its authorized use of the DIALOG Marks, (f) any failure by DIALOG to comply with applicable laws, regulations, and standards, or (g) DIALOG's negligence, intentional misconduct, or fraud.

In this revised clause, the indemnification obligation has been shifted from ENERGOUS to DIALOG. The changes include:

1. Inverting the parties involved in the indemnity agreement, i.e., ENERGOUS is now the one being indemnified, and DIALOG is the one making the indemnification.
2. Modifying the conditions for indemnification, such as shifting the responsibility for compliance with the Product Specifications from ENERGOUS to DIALOG (point d).
3. Altering the language to reflect the changed parties and conditions, i.e., using "shall" instead of "agrees to indemnify," and changing references from ENERGOUS Indemnitees to ENERGOUS and its Affiliates.

(a) Notwithstanding any provision in Section 15.3, during the "Wind Down Period" - commencing from the termination or expiration of this Agreement and lasting until the earlier occurrence of (i) [***] from the Effective Date or (ii) [***] following the effective date of such termination or expiration - both parties shall continue to adhere to their respective obligations under Sections 2 (License), 3 (Sourcing), 7 (Product Sales), 9 (Royalties and Service Fees), 11 (Representations and Warranties; Disclaimers), 12 (Indemnification), 13 (Limitation of Liability), 14 (Compliance with Laws), 15.2 (Termination), 16 (Escrow) and all Exhibits related to these sections, subject to the following exceptions:

   (i) The license rights granted under Section 2.1 (and any sub-licenses extended by DIALOG in accordance with Section 2.4) will be exclusive during the Wind Down Period, only for Products or repackaged Product Dies that DIALOG or its Affiliates have secured a design win from a customer prior to or within one (1) month following the start of the Wind Down Period; and
   (ii) For MCMs that have been released for production at a foundry, the parties' obligations shall continue, but DIALOG will retain no exclusive rights under Section 2.1 (or any sub-licenses granted pursuant to Section 2.4) during the Wind Down Period.

original: 16.3 License. ENERGOUS hereby grants DIALOG a non-exclusive, non-transferable (except as set forth in Section 2) license under the Product IP to use any of the Deposit Materials released from escrow for the purpose of fixing an Epidemic Defect or other Product design or production issue impacting yield or quality during the Term and, if applicable, any Wind Down Period or Continuing Obligation period, including, but not limited to, authorizing any third party subcontractor to manufacture and supply Products, provided, however, that DIALOG continues to make all Royalty payment owed to ENERGOUS (or the then-current owner of the Product IP) as provided in this Agreement. No Service Fees will be payable under this license. DIALOG agrees not to exercise such license until occurrence of a Release Condition, subject to the other restrictions set forth in this Section 16. Such license may be exercised by DIALOG only during the Term and any Wind Down Period or Continuing Obligation period and is subject to DIALOG’s continued compliance with all of the other applicable terms and conditions of this Agreement during any such applicable period. All Deposit Materials will be deemed ENERGOUS’ Confidential Information hereunder. DIALOG’s license to possess and use the Deposit Materials does not include any right to disclose, market, sublicense or distribute the Deposit Materials to any third party other than its Affiliates and Manufacturing Subcontractors.
ollama_generated:
16.3 Licensing Arrangement: DIALOG is granted a non-exclusive, non-transferable license (except as specified in Section 2) by ENERGOUS, under the Product Intellectual Property (Product IP), to utilize any Deposit Materials retrieved from escrow, solely for the purpose of resolving Epidemic Defects or other product design/production issues affecting yield or quality during the Term and subsequent periods such as the Wind Down Period or Continuing Obligation period. This license allows DIALOG to authorize any third-party subcontractor to manufacture and supply products, contingent upon DIALOG's consistent fulfillment of all royalty obligations towards ENERGOUS (or the then-current Product IP owner), as stipulated in this Agreement. No Service Fees are applicable under this license.

It is agreed by DIALOG that it will not exercise this license unless and until a Release Condition has been met, subject to all other restrictions detailed within this Section 16. This licensing right remains valid only during the Term and any subsequent periods such as the Wind Down Period or Continuing Obligation period, and is contingent upon DIALOG's continued compliance with all terms and conditions of this Agreement during those applicable periods. All Deposit Materials are considered ENERGOUS’ Confidential Information under these terms.

DIALOG's possession and use of the Deposit Materials does not grant any right to reveal, commercialize, sublicense or distribute the Deposit Materials to any third party other than its Affiliates and Manufacturing Subcontractors, except as explicitly permitted by this Agreement.

original: 17.1 Publicity.  Within 30 days of the Effective Date each party will issue a mutually agreed joint press release regarding the strategic cooperation for the supply of Products and the strategic cooperation between the parties.
modified: 17.1 Public Discourse: Upon mutual agreement, each party may choose to announce their cooperation in supplying Products and their strategic alliance, at any time following the Effective Date. The specific terms and details of this announcement shall be independently determined by each party. No joint press release will be required unless explicitly agreed upon by both parties.

original: Either party may change its address by giving notice pursuant to, and specifically referring to, this Section 20.
ollama_generated: Should either party elect to update their respective addresses, a written notification in accordance with the procedures outlined in Section 20 shall suffice for such change to take effect.

original: Margin Split:
ollama_generated:
Margin Allocation:

Upon the sale of Goods hereunder, the Parties shall allocate the Net Profit Margins as follows: The Party providing the Goods shall retain an amount equal to fifty percent (50%) of the Net Profit Margin, and the remaining fifty percent (50%) shall be remitted to the other Party. However, in the event that no goods are sold or if there is a loss on sales, neither Party shall owe any amounts to the other Party with respect to the Net Profit Margin.

(Original Clause: Margin Split: The Parties shall share equally the net profit margin derived from the sale of Goods hereunder. Each Party shall be entitled to fifty percent (50%) of the net profit margin on every sale. If there are no sales or if there is a loss on any sales, neither Party shall owe any amounts to the other with respect to the net profit margin.)

original: Notwithstanding any provision of the Agreement, no Royalties or Service Fees will be payable to ENERGOUS hereunder in connection with any Sale to any customer of prototype or sample Licensed Products [***].
ollama_generated: Despite any provisions in the Agreement, ENERGOUS shall not be obligated to receive any Royalties or Service Fees for Sales of prototype or sample Licensed Products [***], according to this contract.

Amended Clause:
In the event that the aforementioned Purchaser is yet to be identified, the obligations under this Agreement shall be suspended until such identification has occurred. Upon identification, the Purchaser shall immediately assume all contractual responsibilities and obligations as set forth herein.

original: Page 28 6. Reporting Upon Energous’ request (but not more frequently than once per calendar year), [Manufacturing Subcontractor] will provide Energous with the accumulated wafer volumes ordered (and shipped) to the Third Party under this Letter of Authorization. By signing this Letter of Authorization, the Third Party authorizes [Manufacturing Subcontractor] to report to Energous accordingly.
ollama_generated: Page 28, Clause 6: At its discretion (but no less than every three years), Energous may request a report from the Manufacturing Subcontractor. The report should detail the total wafer volumes supplied by the Manufacturing Subcontractor to any Third Party, as outlined in this Letter of Authorization. By executing this Letter of Authorization, the Third Party consents to allow [Manufacturing Subcontractor] to disclose such information to Energous when requested.
